channel.title: Question about EasyRSC
channel.description: [b]My question is : How i can only put my easyrsc client and server online my own network... and send my client to my some mates and call them to play it?[/b]

item.title: Question about EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @dedblu2005 dedblu2005@hotmail.com
item.description:
@dedblu2005 wrote:

even if you get your portforward setup you still cant compile so you gotta get some 1 to help you fix that 2, i set up your ant and jdk veriables but u still cant compile

post 2:
http://www.amazon.co.uk/Linksys-WRT54GL-Wireless-G-Broadband-Router/dp/B000ETX928/ref=sr_1_7?s=computers&ie=UTF8&qid=1285487843&sr=1-7

you have jdk, and i set up your environmental variables for java and ant and you still cant compile. so the way i see it you have 4 options.

  1. buy a router get some one to configure and compile your server and client for you (ill even do it for you)(but you will never be able to edit it in any way)

2.buy a router get some one to help you set up your pc to compile then get me (or some one else) to configure it for you

3.get some one else to host it for you, that dose not care if there bandwidth is wasted

4.play on someone’s server that allrdy has it all set up (like me) and follow all there rules

i would pick option 2 but thats me

Read full topic

item.title: Question about EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @I_R_Finnish I R Finnish
item.description:
@I_R_Finnish wrote:

Uh… No, sorry.

im now wordpad… i opened " server " java… big list and codes… where i put my ip ?

Read full topic

item.title: Question about EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @I_R_Finnish I R Finnish
item.description:
@I_R_Finnish wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:361411”]1. Setup server (Server.java) to bind to your local IP address (such as 192.168.1.100). Re-compile server.
2. Port forward TCP 43594 to the said local IP address in your router settings.
3. Configure the client (settings.ini) to connect to your external IP address.[/quote]

Can you post me fast video clip about this? to --> lil_finnish@hotmail.com

Read full topic
